ctaJSON.cta: I build websites that thousands of people love to use every day. Hire me and letâ€™s build something you can brag about.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Hi, I'm Bridger. I'm a self-taught full stack developer living in Boise, Idaho.

My current full-time job is as a QA Analyst, where I work on a fairly large agile team of six developers, an SDET, two QAs, and our product owner. I make sure the developers aren't breaking current reports that we produce for our clients, automate tasks using Python, participate in code reviews, and help prioritize our backlog.

I enjoy building websites and side projects as sort of a second job while I build up enough skills to make that my full-time job. I'm currently accepting freelance and consulting work, so contact me if you need help on any of your ideas!

Outside of work I have an eclectic array of hobbies. These range from mountain biking to drinking only the finest of coffees to hanging out with my girlfriend and our dog, Scout. If you're in the area, let's grab a beer together.

node.title: Case insensitive search with Prisma using indexes

childMarkdownRemark.html: Prisma lacks support for case insensitive queries - so how can you implement a search feature in your app? Indexes!
Turns out that developing a web app for scale requires more moving parts than a simple blog.
When approaching a project, defining the requirements up front gives you a clear path forward and prevents you from wasting countless hours on feature creep.

Each year, beginning right after Christmas, New Year's resolutions enter the media cycle with people discussing their merits and demerits, and sharing their own resolutions. Whether or not you like the idea, most people have them. These are my thoughts.

node.name: Reading Length Classic
node.shortDescription: Book search engine built with vanilla NodeJS receiving over 80,000 unique visitors per month.

node.name: Bridger Putnam
node.shortDescription: My portfolio site, built with a GatsbyJS front-end hosted on Netlify using GraphQL to get data from a Contentful CMS backend. This site is FAST.

node.name: Sick Fits
node.shortDescription: Example eCommerce site built with NextJS, Apollo, and GraphQL (Yoga and Prisma.io). In other words, I built it myself without using any sort of eCommerce platform.

node.name: Catch of the Day
node.shortDescription: Menu website for a fictional restaurant I built to learn React.

node.name: Reading Length 2.0
node.shortDescription: Rebuilt Reading Length with React, Next.js, Yoga, Prisma, and Mongo. Improved page load speed by 600%, decreased bounce rate by 30%. Ongoing project as I continue to receive user feedback and work towards adding user accounts.

shortBio.shortBio: Bridger is a full stack developer and web designer, striving to make a living off of coding so he can have more time in the day to enjoy mountain biking, hiking, skiing, and rock climbing. His focus is on developing websites that are fast and accessible.
